name: Gustav Holst Way (Holst Birthplace Museum to Corndean Lane)

ai.summary: A demanding 25.2 km trek along the Gustav Holst Way, linking the Holst Birthplace Museum to Corndean Lane in the United Kingdom. Expect long, undulating stretches across rural lanes and fields, with some uneven ground and occasional woodland. Best tackled by experienced hikers with solid planning and a good head for navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Undulating rural terrain dominated by field paths and quiet lanes, with occasional woodland and short sections of uneven or muddy footing. Longer ascents and descents in parts, exposure to weather, and variable footing depending on season.
ai.safety_notes: Plan a full-day hike with a reliable map or GPS and a backup navigation method. Wear sturdy boots, and be prepared for mud or slippery surfaces after rain. Carry enough water and high‑energy snacks, weather-appropriate clothing, and a first aid kit. Stay on marked paths where possible, be aware of road-walking sections, and watch for reduced signal in remote stretches. Have a plan for daylight return and inform someone of your route and expected finish time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged mobile phone with offline maps
Rain jacket with hood and waterproof pants
Hat and sunscreen for sun protection
First aid kit and blister care
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Lightweight insulating layer for cooler conditions
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) are typically best for daylight and drier conditions; winter hikes are possible but require greater preparation and experience.

seo.title: Gustav Holst Way Hike: Holst Birthplace Museum to Corndean Lane – 25.2 km Challenge
seo.meta_description: Explore the Gustav Holst Way from the Holst Birthplace Museum to Corndean Lane. A 25.2 km hard hike in the UK with terrain notes, safety tips, gear lists, and best seasons.
